results.title: Jane Campion filmmaker
results.creator_credit: AFTRS and Television and Radio School
results.brief_description: Director Jane Campion tells Peter Thompson of her beginnings as a filmmaker, and her relationship with the film school. This program includes excerpts from Jane’s films “Girls own story” and “Sweetie”.

results.title: Jane Austen in Manhattan
results.creator_credit: Merchant Ivory Productions, Polytel Films, Ismail Merchant and James Ivory
results.brief_description: Anne Baxter, in one of her greatest performances, plays the elegant Lilianna, an actress and drama coach, struggling to produce a newly discovered Jane Austen play. However, the manuscript is in the hands of Pierre (Robert Powell), an ex-student of Lilianna’s, who has broken away from traditional theatre values into bizzare experimental techniques and a raging tug-of-war ensues between the traditional and experimental. Co-starring Michael Wager, Tim Choate, Sean Young, John Guerrasio, Katrina Hodiak, Kurt Johnson, Philip Lenkowsky, Nancy New and Charles McCaughan. Written by Ruth Prawer Jhabvala and based upon Sir Charles Grandison or “The Happy Man”.

results.title: Jane Austen's Emma
results.brief_description: Kate Beckinsale plays Emma, one of Jane Austen’s most beloved heroines. On her way to true love with Mr. Knightly (Mark Strong), Emma becomes involved in matchmaking, romantic intrigue and learns a valuable lesson about interfering in the lives of others. Co-starring Samantha Morton as Harriet, Bernard Hepton as Mr. Woodhouse and Prunella Scales as the garrulous Miss Bates.

results.title: Jana and the crowing hen
results.brief_description: Jana goes to stay with her grandparents on their farm when her mother becomes ill. Jana is suprised to find that her grandmother goes out to work while her grandfather stays at home. Useful in promoting discussions about sex-roles and stereotyping. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Jan Svankmajer. Vol. 1.
results.brief_description: Jan Svankmajer’s animation is witty, macabre, violent and always perverse in its bizarre transformations of objects and beings. His films have spawned many imitations in television advertising, music video and fellow animators. This video contains a retrospective collection of his short films. “Dimensions of dialogue” is a brilliant indictment of human alienation symbolised by cannibalism; “The Flat” pits a man against a malevolent room in a special effects tour de force; two magicians fight to the death in “The Last trick”; while “Down to the cellar” probes the roots of childhood fear; “Virile games” finds all the world’s a battle field.

results.title: Jan Svankmajer. - Volume 2.
results.brief_description: Jan Svankmajer’s animation is witty, macabre, violent, and always perverse in its bizarre transformations of objects and beings. His films have spawned many imitations in television advertising, music video and has inspired fellow animators. This video contains a retrospective collection of his short films. “Jabberwocky” interprets Lewis Carroll’s verse as a last magical adventure before adulthood; “J.S. Bach: fantasia in G minor” probes the mystery of the real with the great composer’s help; domestic mayhem is on the menu in “Punch and Judy”; while “Leonardo’s diary” transports the renaissance polymath to the twentieth century; “The Ossuary” tours the ultimate bone-yard, a monument to the Black Death; and in “The Death of Stalinism in Bohemia” Svankmajer hammers an animated nail in the coffin of Czech communism.

results.title: Jan Stephenson's How to Golf
results.brief_description: How to Golf is a 50 minute cassette that addresses each and every aspect of the game of golf, from driving off the tee to effective hazard play. Each segment is colour coded for easy referral to the areas of your game that need work most. Suitable for male and female golf enthusiasts of all ages and abilities, starring one of the most recognisable sports personalities world-wide - Jan Stephenson.

results.title: Jamon jamon [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lola Films, Ovideo TV, Andres Gomes and Jose Bigas Luna
results.brief_description: Bigas Luna co-wrote and directed “Jamon jamon”, which stars Penelope Cruz and Javier Bardem, both Spanish actors who would go on to achieve fame in America. “Jamon jamon” is a comedy/drama set in the arid region of Monegros, Spain. Jose Luis is a young executive working in an underwear factory, run by his overbearing mother and passive father. Luis is having a relationship with a factory girl Silvia (Cruz) who is pregnant with his child. Jose’s mother Conchita, is horrified by the thought of her son marrying anyone at all, let alone a factory worker whose mother is a prostitute. Conchita sets about scuttling her son’s plans by hiring Raul, a handsome would be bullfighter to woo Silvia. Complications ensue all round as Conchita takes a liking to Raul herself and Jose cannot pass up his fondness for sleeping with Silvia’s mother (who also has a past history with Jose’s father). “Jamon jamon” is a film about sex, love, infidelity, passion, loyalty and family. Heavy symbolism reflects a macho culture driven by male desire for assuaging of ego and ratification of sexual prowess. Features numerous erotic heterosexual scenes. Winner of the Silver Lion at the 1992 Venice Film Festival.

results.title: Jamie: the story of a sibling
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and John Howe
results.brief_description: The film shows how the emotional development of children is affected by parental attitudes and by competition for parental attention. Jamie in this film is a ten-year-old, an age when it hurts if you fail to win a parent’s approval, or if you must give way because you are the youngest in the family. Parents who want to know what goes on inside a child’s mind will find Jamie, and the family of which he is part, a provocative, revealing study. Intended for discussion purposes by only depicting the situation. Cast: Ron Cahoon, James Dougal, Jill Foster, Danny McIlravey, Paula McKeown.

results.title: Jamie: a behavioural approach to family intervention (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles. Media Center and J Loebsen
results.brief_description: Jamie is a pre-school child whose behaviour problems disturb his family life. Jamies’ parents discuss with a therapist their response to Jamie’s behaviour and the benefits of the classes they attend, which provide a program to modify both Jamie’s actions and his parents attitude to his behaviour.
